message.content:
<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: You can use the Apache CXF library to parse MTOM/XOP SOAP responses. Here's an example of how you can do it:

1. Add the Apache CXF library to your project's dependencies.

2. Use the following code to parse the MTOM/XOP SOAP response:

import org.apache.cxf.attachment.AttachmentDeserializer;
import org.apache.cxf.message.Attachment;
import org.apache.cxf.message.Message;
import org.apache.cxf.message.MessageImpl;
import org.apache.cxf.phase.PhaseInterceptorChain;
import org.apache.cxf.staxutils.StaxUtils;

// Assuming you have the MTOM/XOP SOAP response in an InputStream called responseInputStream
InputStream responseInputStream = ...;

// Create a CXF Message object
Message message = new MessageImpl();

// Set the input stream as the content of the message
message.setContent(InputStream.class, responseInputStream);

// Set the content type of the message
message.put(Message.CONTENT_TYPE, "multipart/related");

// Get the interceptor chain
PhaseInterceptorChain chain = PhaseInterceptorChain.getCurrentMessage();

// Create an AttachmentDeserializer
AttachmentDeserializer attachmentDeserializer = new AttachmentDeserializer(message);

// Deserialize the attachments
List<Attachment> attachments = attachmentDeserializer.getAttachments();

// Iterate over the attachments and process them as needed
for (Attachment attachment : attachments) {
    // Process the attachment
    // ...
}

// Get the SOAP body content
XMLStreamReader reader = StaxUtils.createXMLStreamReader(responseInputStream);
StaxUtils.toNextElement(reader); // Move to the SOAP body element
String soapBodyContent = StaxUtils.readElementText(reader);

// Close the input stream
responseInputStream.close();

// Process the SOAP body content as needed
// ...

<<<explanation>>>: The code above uses the Apache CXF library to parse MTOM/XOP SOAP responses. It creates a CXF Message object and sets the MTOM/XOP SOAP response as the content of the message. It then uses an AttachmentDeserializer to deserialize the attachments and process them as needed. Finally, it uses StaxUtils to read the SOAP body content and process it as needed.
